tests.name: High Concurrent User Load Test
tests.description: Simulate a large number of concurrent users (e.g., 2000 virtual users) performing typical browsing and shopping actions to assess the website's ability to handle peak traffic without performance degradation or errors. This tests the web server, application server, and database concurrency.
steps: Initialize N (e.g., 2000) virtual users.
Each virtual user navigates to the homepage (https://demo.nopcommerce.com).
Each virtual user performs a search for 'computer' by entering 'computer' into the input with name 'q' and clicking the 'SEARCH' button.
Each virtual user navigates to the 'Computers' category (https://demo.nopcommerce.com/computers).
Each virtual user then navigates to the 'Desktops' sub-category (https://demo.nopcommerce.com/desktops).
Each virtual user views a product page, e.g., 'Digital Storm Vanquish Custom Performance PC' (https://demo.nopcommerce.com/digital-storm-vanquish-custom-performance-pc).
A subset of virtual users (e.g., 30%) clicks the 'ADD TO CART' button on a product page.
A smaller subset of virtual users (e.g., 10%) attempts to log in using the 'Log in' link (https://demo.nopcommerce.com/login?returnUrl=%2F) and submitting test credentials.
tests.expected_result: The website should maintain an average response time for page loads and API calls below 3 seconds. Error rates (e.g., HTTP 5xx) should remain below 0.1%. The application should not crash or become unresponsive, and all transactions (search, navigation, add to cart, login) should complete successfully.

tests.name: Sustained Memory Load and Leak Detection Test
tests.description: Simulate a moderate number of concurrent users performing repetitive, memory-intensive actions over an extended period (e.g., 4-8 hours) to identify potential memory leaks, excessive memory consumption, or resource exhaustion in the application and database servers.
steps: Initialize M (e.g., 200) virtual users.
Each virtual user repeatedly performs the following loop for the duration of the test:
- Navigate to the homepage (https://demo.nopcommerce.com).

- Browse through multiple main categories: 'Computers' (https://demo.nopcommerce.com/computers), 'Electronics' (https://demo.nopcommerce.com/electronics), 'Apparel' (https://demo.nopcommerce.com/apparel).
- Within each category, navigate to at least two sub-categories (e.g., 'Desktops', 'Notebooks' under 'Computers').
- View 3-5 different product detail pages (e.g., 'Apple MacBook Pro', 'HTC Smartphone', 'Digital Storm Vanquish Custom Performance PC').
- Perform a search with a long, complex query (e.g., 'high performance gaming laptop with ssd and 16gb ram') using the input with name 'q' and clicking the 'SEARCH' button.
- Add a product to the wishlist using the 'Add to wishlist' button.
Continuously monitor the memory usage (RAM, heap size) of the web server, application server, and database server throughout the test duration.
tests.expected_result: Memory usage on all monitored servers should remain stable or fluctuate within a defined acceptable range, without a continuous upward trend indicating a memory leak. The application should not experience out-of-memory errors or significant performance degradation over time.

tests.name: High Latency and Low Bandwidth Performance Test
tests.description: Evaluate the website's responsiveness and user experience when accessed under simulated high network latency (e.g., 300-500ms RTT) and/or limited bandwidth (e.g., 1-2 Mbps). This tests the application's resilience to network constraints and its ability to handle slow client connections gracefully.
steps: Configure the test environment to simulate network conditions: introduce a minimum of 300ms latency for all network requests and limit bandwidth to 2 Mbps.
Initialize P (e.g., 100) virtual users.
Each virtual user performs the following actions:
- Navigate to the homepage (https://demo.nopcommerce.com).
- Click on the 'Register' link (https://demo.nopcommerce.com/register?returnUrl=%2F).
- Fill out the registration form with valid but unique data for 'FirstName', 'LastName', 'Email', 'Password', 'ConfirmPassword' and click the 'REGISTER' button.
- Navigate to the 'Shopping cart (0)' link (https://demo.nopcommerce.com/cart).
- Navigate back to the homepage and perform a search for 'book' using the input with name 'q' and clicking the 'SEARCH' button.
- Navigate to a product page (e.g., 'Apple MacBook Pro' at https://demo.nopcommerce.com/apple-macbook-pro) and click 'ADD TO CART'.
Monitor the end-to-end response times for each step and observe for timeouts or incomplete page loads.
tests.expected_result: All pages and resources should eventually load completely, even if slowly. Critical transactions (registration, add to cart, search) should complete successfully without network-related errors (e.g., timeouts, connection resets). The application should not exhibit broken UI elements or unresponsive behavior due to network delays. Average page load times might increase but should not exceed a reasonable threshold (e.g., 15-20 seconds for complex pages under these conditions).

tests.name: Intensive Database Read/Write Load Test
tests.description: Subject the database to a high volume of read and write operations to identify performance bottlenecks, connection pool issues, and ensure data integrity under extreme load. This simulates scenarios like flash sales or heavy user activity on product pages and search.
steps: Initialize Q (e.g., 1500) virtual users.

A large percentage of virtual users (e.g., 60%) repeatedly perform searches with a diverse set of keywords (e.g., 'laptop', 'phone', 'shoes', 'book', 'jewelry', 'gift card') using the input with name 'q' and clicking the 'SEARCH' button. This generates heavy read load on product catalogs and search indexes.

Another significant percentage (e.g., 30%) repeatedly navigates to various product detail pages (e.g., 'https://demo.nopcommerce.com/build-your-own-computer', 'https://demo.nopcommerce.com/apple-macbook-pro', 'https://demo.nopcommerce.com/htc-smartphone', 'https://demo.nopcommerce.com/25-virtual-gift-card'). This generates heavy read load for product attributes, descriptions, and related data.

A smaller percentage (e.g., 10%) repeatedly attempts to add products to the shopping cart using the 'ADD TO CART' button on various product pages. This generates write load for cart updates and session management.
Monitor database server metrics (CPU, I/O, active connections, query execution times, lock contention) throughout the test.
tests.expected_result: The database server should remain stable and responsive, handling the high volume of queries without crashing or becoming a bottleneck. Average query execution times should remain within acceptable limits (e.g., < 500ms). The database connection pool should not be exhausted, and no data corruption or integrity issues should be observed.
